column4: i have a problem with my Sis graphic card - there is only the resolution 640x320 available, any suggestions?
set the driver to be "sis" in /etc/X11/xorg.conf
then add the resolution lines to the screen section
how  can i add these lines??

Section "monitor" #  Identifier "monitor1"  Vendorname "Plug 'n' Play"Modelname "Plug 'n' Play"  modeline  "640x480@60" 25.2 640 656 752 800 480 490 492 525 -vsync -hsync  Gamma 1.0         What should i do here???
can you pastebin your xorg.conf as I cant make sense of that
i have a SiS Mirage 3+ graphic card ... but no idea what to change in the confg
looks ok to me, you say you only have 800x600?
only 640x320 at the moment, it was 840 before but after 1 change at gksu displayconfig -gtk there's only 640 available
i dont understand the lines below line 83
should i copy the part with the resolution?
id make a backup of your xorg.conf the use recovery to repair it
then reconfigure, yours seems to have a lot of stuff for what is essentially config for mouse keyboard screen and vga
thx, i will try it tomorrow
